nodes.label: Paranoid (1970)
nodes.details: Black Sabbath's defining single, written hastily to fill album space, became their signature song reaching #4 UK charts and establishing the heavy metal template.

nodes.label: Black Sabbath
nodes.details: Birmingham working-class band formed in 1968, originally named Earth, pioneered heavy metal with darker themes and down-tuned guitars.

nodes.label: Ozzy Osbourne
nodes.details: Lead vocalist whose paranoia-laden lyrics and distinctive voice became metal's first iconic frontman persona.

nodes.label: Tony Iommi
nodes.details: Guitarist who lost fingertips in industrial accident, developed heavy, down-tuned style that defined metal guitar sound.

nodes.label: Geezer Butler
nodes.details: Bassist and primary lyricist, wrote Paranoid's lyrics about mental health struggles and societal alienation.

nodes.label: Bill Ward
nodes.details: Drummer whose jazz-influenced style and powerful playing anchored Sabbath's revolutionary rhythm section.

nodes.label: Post-war Birmingham
nodes.details: Declining industrial city where factory workers' sons channeled economic despair into heavy, dystopian music reflecting working-class reality.

nodes.label: Vietnam War Era
nodes.details: Anti-war sentiment and social unrest of 1970 directly influenced Paranoid's themes of paranoia and societal breakdown.

nodes.label: Cold War Paranoia
nodes.details: Nuclear anxiety and social surveillance fears of the early 1970s permeated the album's psychological themes.

nodes.label: Blues Rock Foundation
nodes.details: Traditional blues progressions and pentatonic scales formed the structural foundation beneath Sabbath's heavier approach.

nodes.label: Psychedelic Movement
nodes.details: Late-60s psychedelia's experimental approach and darker themes influenced Sabbath's sonic exploration.

nodes.label: Cream
nodes.details: Power trio format and blues-rock intensity directly influenced Black Sabbath's early sound and arrangement approach.

nodes.label: Led Zeppelin
nodes.details: Contemporary heavy blues rock that shared Birmingham origins and influenced Sabbath's dynamic range and mystical themes.

nodes.label: Heavy Metal Origins
nodes.details: Paranoid established the sonic template for heavy metal: down-tuned guitars, occult imagery, and working-class rebellion.

nodes.label: New Wave of British Heavy Metal
nodes.details: 1970s-80s British metal movement that drew directly from Sabbath's blueprint, spreading metal globally.

nodes.label: Doom Metal
nodes.details: Subgenre that emerged from Sabbath's slower, heavier tracks, emphasizing atmosphere and psychological weight.

nodes.label: Gaming Soundtrack
nodes.details: Paranoid found new life in video game soundtracks, particularly tactical games where its intensity enhances gameplay.

timelineEvents.title: UK Single Released
timelineEvents.description: Paranoid single released in the UK, reaching #4 on the charts. Written in 20 minutes to fill album space, it became their biggest hit and defined heavy metal's sound template.

timelineEvents.title: Paranoid Album Released
timelineEvents.description: The complete Paranoid album released, featuring War Pigs, Iron Man, and the title track. Recorded at Regent Sound Studios for Â£500, it would sell millions and influence generations.

timelineEvents.title: US Single Released
timelineEvents.description: Paranoid released in the United States, reaching #61 on Billboard Hot 100. American radio initially resisted the heavy sound, but underground popularity grew rapidly.

timelineEvents.title: Album Title Controversy
timelineEvents.description: Originally titled 'War Pigs' after the opening track, Vertigo Records demanded a title change due to Vietnam War sensitivity. The hastily-written Paranoid became both title track and biggest hit.

timelineEvents.title: NWOBHM Movement
timelineEvents.description: New Wave of British Heavy Metal bands like Iron Maiden, Saxon, and Diamond Head cite Paranoid as foundational influence, spreading heavy metal globally and establishing it as legitimate genre.

timelineEvents.title: Grunge Recognition
timelineEvents.description: Grunge pioneers acknowledge Sabbath's influence. Kurt Cobain and others cite Paranoid's raw emotion and working-class themes as precursor to alternative rock's authenticity.

timelineEvents.title: Gaming Culture Integration
timelineEvents.description: Paranoid gains new audiences through video game soundtracks, particularly in tactical shooters like Helldivers where its intensity enhances cooperative gameplay experiences.

waveRegions.label: Iconic Opening Riff
waveRegions.description: The instantly recognizable main riff that established heavy metal's signature sound - simple, powerful, and unforgettable.

waveRegions.label: First Verse - Paranoia Lyrics
waveRegions.description: Ozzy's vocals enter with Geezer Butler's lyrics about mental health struggles and social alienation, themes revolutionary for rock music.

waveRegions.label: Guitar Solo Section
waveRegions.description: Tony Iommi's guitar solo showcases the heavy, sustained tone that would influence metal guitar playing for decades.

waveRegions.label: Second Verse & Bridge
waveRegions.description: The song builds intensity as lyrics delve deeper into paranoid psychology, backed by Bill Ward's driving rhythm.

waveRegions.label: Final Chorus & Outro
waveRegions.description: The concluding section that leaves listeners with the unforgettable riff, cementing its place in rock history.
